CatDescriptText: Mr. William D. Shields, scrap dealer, Creighton and Mr. F.G. Reynolds, insurance company vice president, Bethel Park, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, September 30, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Do you think the United States should go to war with Russia over Berlin?" Mr. Shields' answer reads: "We shouldn't stop short of war, because our integrity is at stake."  Mr. Reynolds' answer reads: "Absolutely not, because we lost the battle at Yalta.  I'm talking about the partition of Germany, which left us only with free access Berlin."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of William D. Shields wearing plaid suit jacket and striped necktie, standing in front of row of stores; Portrait of F.G. Reynolds wearing dark suit jacket and striped necktie, standing in front of buildings
